definition: scholar-official in the Qing dynasty (1764-1849)
ruan, a four-stringed Chinese lute
surname Ruan/small state during the Shang Dynasty (1600-1046 BC) located in the southeast of modern-day Gansu Province
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)

sentences.english: Ruan Yuan was an important minister and a famous author of Jin Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 阮元是清代重臣，也是一位著名的圖書編撰家。

definition: Hong Liangji (1746-1809), poet and historian
Wang Shizhen (1634-1711), early Qing poet
Zhao Yi (1727-1814), Qing dynasty poet and historian, one of Three great poets of the Qianlong era 乾嘉三大家
Ji Yun (1724-1805), Qing Dynasty writer, author of supernatural novel Notes on a Minutely Observed Thatched Hut 閱微草堂筆記|阅微草堂笔记
Gu Yanwu (1613-1682), late Ming and early Qing Confucian philosopher, linguist and historian, played a founding role in phonology of early Chinese, author of Rizhilu or Record of daily study 日知錄|日知录
Huang Zongxi (1610-1695), scholar and writer of the Ming-Qing transition
Wen Zhengming (1470-1559), Ming painter, one of Four great southern talents of the Ming 江南四大才子
to compile/to edit/compilation
Zhu Yunming (1460-1526), Ming dynasty calligrapher
Wang Fuzhi (1619-1692), wide-ranging scholar of the Ming-Qing transition
Gong Zizhen (1792-1841), Chinese man of letters, calligrapher and poet
Zhang Pu (1602-1641), Ming dynasty scholar and prolific writer, proponent of 複社|复社[fu4 she4] cultural renewal movement, author of Five tombstone inscriptions 五人墓碑記|五人墓碑记[wu3 ren2 mu4 bei1 ji4]
Yuan Mei (1716-1798), famous Qing poet and critic, one of Three great poets of the Qianlong era 乾嘉三大家
Lin Shu (1852-1924), writer and influential translator and adaptor of vast swathes of Western literature into Classical Chinese
